channel.title: Bulgaria on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in Bulgaria on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 FK Dunav 2010 Logo
FC Dunav is a Bulgarian professional football club based in Ruse, which currently competes in the Third League, the third tier of the Bulgarian football league system. Part of a larger sports branch, Dunav were established on February 16, 1949 as a merger of two local football clubs in the city, Dinamo and Rusenets. Nicknamed The Dragons, Dunav’s home colours are sky blue and white. Named after the Danube River, on the banks of which the city of Ruse is situated, the club plays its home matches at the local Gradski stadion, which has a seating capacity of 13,000 spectators.
You can download theDunavlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Dunav
item.description: FC Dunav is a Bulgarian professional football club based in Ruse, which currently competes in the Third League, the third tier of the Bulgarian football league system. Part of a larger sports branch, Dunav were established on February 16, 1949 as a merger of two local football clubs in the city, Dinamo and Rusenets. Nicknamed The Dragons, Dunav’s home colours are sky blue and white. Named after the Danube River, on the banks of which the city of Ruse is situated, the club plays its home matches at the local Gradski stadion, which has a seating capacity of 13,000 spectators.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 FK Minyor Pernik Logo
FC Minyor is a football club in Pernik, Bulgaria, that competes in the Second League, the second tier of Bulgarian football. Founded in 1919 as SC Krakra, the club’s home ground since 1954 has been Stadion Minyor. The club’s name comes from the fact that the area around the city of Pernik has had long traditions with mining and the mining industry. The club’s highest league finish in the top division is fourth, which was achieved in the 1955 and 1960–61 seasons.
You can download theMinyor Perniklogo on full-version of the page.
]] >

The club’s name comes from the fact that the area around the city of Pernik has had long traditions with mining and the mining industry. The club’s highest league finish in the top division is fourth, which was achieved in the 1955 and 1960–61 seasons.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 OSK AS-23 Logo
Officers' Sports Club Atletik-Slava 1923, Atletik-Slava 23, or simply AS-23, was a Bulgarian army officers' football club based in the capital of Sofia. The club colors were black and white and its emblem was a black lion over a white shield. Home ground was what today is the Bulgarian Army Stadium. The club’s motto was “Athleticism and Glory.”
Source
You can download theAtletik-Slavalogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Atletik-Slava
item.description: Officers' Sports Club Atletik-Slava 1923, Atletik-Slava 23, or simply AS-23, was a Bulgarian army officers' football club based in the capital of Sofia. The club colors were black and white and its emblem was a black lion over a white shield. Home ground was what today is the Bulgarian Army Stadium. The club’s motto was “Athleticism and Glory.” Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Botev Plovdiv Logo
Profesionalen futbolen klub Botev, commonly referred to as Botev Plovdiv or simply Botev, is a Bulgarian professional football club based in Plovdiv, Bulgaria, that competes in the Bulgarian Parva Liga, the top flight of Bulgarian football. Founded on 11 March 1912, it is the country’s oldest active football club. Botev is named after the Bulgarian national hero Hristo Botev. The club plays its home games at Botev 1912 Football Complex, located in the neighbourhood of Komatevo, while its stadium is under reconstruction.
You can download theBotev Plovdivlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Botev Plovdiv
item.description: Profesionalen futbolen klub Botev, commonly referred to as Botev Plovdiv or simply Botev, is a Bulgarian professional football club based in Plovdiv, Bulgaria, that competes in the Bulgarian Parva Liga, the top flight of Bulgarian football. Founded on 11 March 1912, it is the country’s oldest active football club. Botev is named after the Bulgarian national hero Hristo Botev. The club plays its home games at Botev 1912 Football Complex, located in the neighbourhood of Komatevo, while its stadium is under reconstruction.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 PFC Levski Sofia Logo
Levski Sofia is a Bulgarian professional association football club based in Sofia, which competes in the First League, the top division of the Bulgarian football league system. The club was founded on 24 May 1914 as a football department of Levski Sofia sports club by a group of students, and is named after Vasil Levski, a Bulgarian revolutionary renowned as the national hero of the country. Levski has won a total of 73 trophies, including 26 national titles, 25 national cups and 3 supercups, as well as 13 domestic Doubles and 1 Treble.
You can download theLevski Sofialogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Levski Sofia
item.description: Levski Sofia is a Bulgarian professional association football club based in Sofia, which competes in the First League, the top division of the Bulgarian football league system. The club was founded on 24 May 1914 as a football department of Levski Sofia sports club by a group of students, and is named after Vasil Levski, a Bulgarian revolutionary renowned as the national hero of the country. Levski has won a total of 73 trophies, including 26 national titles, 25 national cups and 3 supercups, as well as 13 domestic Doubles and 1 Treble.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 PFC Litex Lovech Logo
Litex is a Bulgarian professional association football club based in Lovech, which currently competes in the Second League. The club was founded in 1921 as Hisarya Sports Club. The club’s home ground is the Lovech Stadium, which has a capacity of 8,100 seats, electric floodlights and permission to stage European matches. As one of the successful Bulgarian clubs outside the capital Sofia, Litex have won the domestic championship four times and the Bulgarian Cup on four occasions.
You can download theLitex Lovechlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Litex Lovech
item.description: Litex is a Bulgarian professional association football club based in Lovech, which currently competes in the Second League. The club was founded in 1921 as Hisarya Sports Club. The club’s home ground is the Lovech Stadium, which has a capacity of 8,100 seats, electric floodlights and permission to stage European matches. As one of the successful Bulgarian clubs outside the capital Sofia, Litex have won the domestic championship four times and the Bulgarian Cup on four occasions.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 PFC Ludogorets Razgrad Logo
Professional Football Club Ludogorets 1945, commonly known as Ludogorets Razgrad or simply Ludogorets, is a Bulgarian professional association football club founded in 1945 based in Razgrad which currently competes in the First Professional Football League, the top-tier of the Bulgarian football league system. In their inaugural 2011–12 season in A Group after promotion, Ludogorets won the treble by capturing the league championship, the Bulgarian Cup and the Bulgarian Supercup. Subsequently, the club made a significant continental impact in the 2013–14 UEFA Europa League when they reached the Round of 16 in only their second European run.
You can download theLudogorets Razgradlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Ludogorets Razgrad
item.description: Professional Football Club Ludogorets 1945, commonly known as Ludogorets Razgrad or simply Ludogorets, is a Bulgarian professional association football club founded in 1945 based in Razgrad which currently competes in the First Professional Football League, the top-tier of the Bulgarian football league system. In their inaugural 2011–12 season in A Group after promotion, Ludogorets won the treble by capturing the league championship, the Bulgarian Cup and the Bulgarian Supercup. Subsequently, the club made a significant continental impact in the 2013–14 UEFA Europa League when they reached the Round of 16 in only their second European run.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 PFC Slavia Sofia Logo
PFC Slavia Sofia is a Bulgarian professional association football club based in Sofia, which currently competes in the top tier of the Bulgarian football league system, the First League. Slavia’s home ground is the Slavia Stadium in Ovcha kupel with a capacity of 25,556. The team’s colours are white and black. Established on 10 April 1913, Slavia is currently the oldest sports club in Sofia. Slavia is one of only two Bulgarian football clubs that have never been relegated, although the club has been divided into two separate clubs and one of them that carries Slavia records and statistics had been expelled to the Second Division, which continued for a season, for no other reason, but politically arranged football reform.
You can download theSlavia Sofialogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Slavia Sofia
item.description: PFC Slavia Sofia is a Bulgarian professional association football club based in Sofia, which currently competes in the top tier of the Bulgarian football league system, the First League. Slavia’s home ground is the Slavia Stadium in Ovcha kupel with a capacity of 25,556. The team’s colours are white and black. Established on 10 April 1913, Slavia is currently the oldest sports club in Sofia. Slavia is one of only two Bulgarian football clubs that have never been relegated, although the club has been divided into two separate clubs and one of them that carries Slavia records and statistics had been expelled to the Second Division, which continued for a season, for no other reason, but politically arranged football reform.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 FC Spartak Varna Logo
FK Spartak 1918 Varna is a Bulgarian association football phoenix club based in Varna, which currently competes in the Second League, the second level of Bulgarian football league system. Spartak plays its home matches at the local Stadion Spartak. Spartak established itself as one of the pioneering teams in Bulgarian football. They won the Bulgarian league in 1932, and were runners up in 1931 and 1933. Spartak have spent the majority of their existence in the first two tiers of Bulgarian football, although their last top flight participation has been during the season 2008-09.
You can download theSpartak Varnalogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Spartak Varna
item.description: FK Spartak 1918 Varna is a Bulgarian association football phoenix club based in Varna, which currently competes in the Second League, the second level of Bulgarian football league system. Spartak plays its home matches at the local Stadion Spartak. Spartak established itself as one of the pioneering teams in Bulgarian football. They won the Bulgarian league in 1932, and were runners up in 1931 and 1933. Spartak have spent the majority of their existence in the first two tiers of Bulgarian football, although their last top flight participation has been during the season 2008-09.

Cooolbox Logo Cooolbox is a Bulgarian telecommunications company. It was launched in 1997 as ITD Network.The Cooolbox network is entirely built on the FTTH - AON technology and provide super fast gigabit internet in Sofia, Plovdiv and Veliko Tarnovo. Source
You can download theCooolboxlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Cooolbox
item.description: Cooolbox is a Bulgarian telecommunications company. It was launched in 1997 as ITD Network.The Cooolbox network is entirely built on the FTTH - AON technology and provide super fast gigabit internet in Sofia, Plovdiv and Veliko Tarnovo. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Bulsatcom Logo
Bulsatcom is Bulgarian satellite television, internet & mobile operator, founded in year 2000 as the first DVB-C operator in the country. The company is operated from Sofia and Stara Zagora. Since 2009 it has entered the internet service provisioning market and since 2015 the company also provides 4G LTE mobile data services. The company is currently the biggest in term of number of pay-TV subscribers in Bulgaria and has added in late 2015 IPTV services to its product portfolio.
You can download theBulsatcomlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Bulsatcom
item.description: Bulsatcom is Bulgarian satellite television, internet & mobile operator, founded in year 2000 as the first DVB-C operator in the country. The company is operated from Sofia and Stara Zagora. Since 2009 it has entered the internet service provisioning market and since 2015 the company also provides 4G LTE mobile data services. The company is currently the biggest in term of number of pay-TV subscribers in Bulgaria and has added in late 2015 IPTV services to its product portfolio.
